alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Conecuh; Escambia; Monroe; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 3:25PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Monroe, northern Mobile, northwestern Baldwin, southeastern Washington, south central Clarke, western Escambia, southwestern Conecuh and northwestern Escambia Counties through 430 PM CDT... At 324 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southeast of Wagarville to 3 miles northwest of Calvert to Citronelle. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Atmore, Citronelle, Stockton, McCullough, Uriah, Calvert, Mount Vernon, McIntosh, I65 And CR 1, I65 And AL 113, I65 And AL 21, Movico and Poarch Creek Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for south central and southwestern Alabama...and northwestern Florida.
